thesis_damage_flags.why: No prior portfolio found/verified via tools in this run; cannot assess holding-level thesis damage.

thesis: Data integrity constraint: rules require only verifiable tool-fetched data; none was fetched/available, so no evidence-based change can be justified deterministically.
Portfolio continuity: without a verified prior portfolio state, any add/trim/replace would be arbitrary and non-reproducible across models.
Risk control: avoiding unverified trades prevents inadvertent breaches of universe/sector/position constraints and avoids acting on potentially stale or incorrect information.
risks: Opportunity cost if a high-quality momentum setup exists today but cannot be verified in this run.
Drift risk if the (unknown) existing portfolio has become misaligned with quality+momentum objectives since last rebalance.
Information lag: material earnings/guidance/news in the last 24–72 hours may warrant action, but cannot be confirmed here.
falsifiable_checks: If tool-verified prior holdings and latest prices/returns are available, recompute 1–12 month momentum and quality screens; if any holding falls below predefined thresholds, propose a replace/trim next run.
If tool-verified earnings/guidance/news shows a holding with negative revision or material thesis break (e.g., margin collapse, demand shock), flag and propose action next run.
